Top-3 Scripts:
ul_250562: ##Wireless NIC
allow-hotplug wlan0
iface wlan0 inet manual
wpa-roam /etc/wpa_supplicant/wpa_supplicant.conf
iface open_wifi inet dhcp

ctrl_interface=DIR=/var/run/wpa_supplicant GROUP=netdev
update_config=1

##Open_Wifi
network={
    ssid=""
    key_mgmt=NONE
    id_str="open_wifi"
}

wpa_supplicant -d -i wlan0 -c /etc/wpa_supplicant/wpa_supplicant.conf -D wext

ul_283722: sudo ip link set wlan0 down
sudo ip link set wlan0 up
sudo wpa_supplicant -B -iwlan0 -c /etc/wpa_supplicant.conf -Dnl80211,wext
sudo dhclient wlan0

wpa_supplicant -B -i wlan0 -c <(wpa_passphrase "Your_SSID" Your_passphrase) && dhclient wlan0

ul_263826: sudo -i
echo "ctrl_interface=DIR=/var/run/wpa_supplicant GROUP=sudo" > /etc/wpa_supplicant/wpa_supplicant-wlan0.conf
wpa_passphrase SSID password >> /etc/wpa_supplicant/wpa_supplicant-wlan0.conf

Explanations about Options.-D:
Driver to use (can be multiple drivers: nl80211,wext). (Per interface, see the
 available options below.)
Explanations about Options.-i:
Interface to listen on. Multiple instances of this option can be present, one per
 interface, separated by -N option (see below).

Explanations about Options.--interface:
Use network interface <s>. If this option is not specified, arp-scan will search
 the system interface list for the lowest numbered, configured up interface
 (excluding loopback). The interface specified must support ARP.

ul_108320: $ git clone http://github.com/lwfinger/rtlwifi_new.git
$ cd rtlwifi_new
$ make
$ sudo modprobe -rv rtl8188ee
$ sudo make install
$ sudo modprobe -v rtl8188ee

Explanations about Options.-r:
This option causes modprobe to remove rather than insert a module. If the modules it
 depends on are also unused, modprobe will try to remove them too. Unlike insertion,
 more than one module can be specified on the command line (it does not make sense to
 specify module parameters when removing modules).
Explanations about Options.-f:
Try to strip any versioning information from the module which might otherwise stop it
 from loading: this is the same as using both --force-vermagic and --force-modversion.
 Naturally, these checks are there for your protection, so using this option is
 dangerous unless you know what you are doing.
Explanations about Options.-v:
Print messages about what the program is doing. Usually modprobe only prints messages
 if something goes wrong.

Explanations about Options.-i:
Ignore case distinctions in patterns and input data, so that characters that differ
 only in case match each other.
Explanations about Options.--only-matching:
Print only the matched (non-empty) parts of a matching line, with each such part on
 a separate output line.

Top-3 Similar Questions: ul_400901: Connect to WEP/WPA without nmcli?
Top-3 Scripts:
ul_400901: touch /etc/wpa_supplicant/wpa_supplicant.conf
echo ctrl_interface=/run/wpa_supplicant > /etc/wpa_supplicant/wpa_supplicant.conf
echo update_config=1 >> /etc/wpa_supplicant/wpa_supplicant.conf
wpa_passphrase "Your_SSID" Your_PASSWORD >> /etc/wpa_supplicant/wpa_supplicant.conf
i=$(iw dev | grep Interface | awk '{ print $2}')
killall wpa_supplicant
wpa_supplicant -i $i -c/etc/wpa_supplicant/wpa_supplicant.conf -B
dhclient $i
